Convert a list of data frames into one data frame

Ivan Jacob Agaloos Pesigan

Source: vignettes/articles/data_wrangling_list_to_df.Rmd
data_wrangling_list_to_df.Rmd

Generate data

generate_data <- function(n_list,
                          n_columns,
                          n_rows) {
  exe <- function(n_columns = n_columns,
                  n_rows = n_rows) {
    as.data.frame(
      replicate(
        n = n_columns,
        expr = rnorm(n = n_rows)
      )
    )
  }
  n_columns <- rep(
    x = n_columns,
    times = n_list
  )
  lapply(
    X = n_columns,
    FUN = exe,
    n_rows = n_rows
  )
}
list_of_dataframes <- generate_data(
  n_list = 5,
  n_columns = 5,
  n_rows = 5
)

Base R

do.call(
  what = "rbind",
  args = list_of_dataframes
)

Benchmark

microbenchmark::microbenchmark(
  base = do.call(
    what = "rbind",
    args = list_of_dataframes
  ),
  dplyr = dplyr::bind_rows(
    list_of_dataframes,
    .id = "column_label"
  ),
  data.table = data.table::rbindlist(
    l = list_of_dataframes
  ),
  times = 1000
)
## Unit: microseconds
##        expr     min      lq     mean   median       uq      max neval
##        base 219.857 248.350 297.1116 263.5710 294.4000 3916.660  1000
##       dplyr 133.031 152.360 180.4678 162.8565 184.3265 2965.871  1000
##  data.table  80.090 101.024 124.4547 112.0620 127.4165 2881.757  1000
